dashboard.title: Renforcer les preuves de la performance des systèmes de santé au Burkina Faso
dashboard.subtitle: Analyse de tendance de la mortalite et morbidite

sections.title: Objectifs
sections.content:
1.1 Objectif général

Analyser les tendances de la mortalité et de la morbidité au Burkina Faso.

1.2. Objectifs spécifiques

Les objectifs spécifiques sont :


• Évolution temporelle des indicateurs de mortalité : Évaluer l'évolution temporelle des indicateurs de mortalité au niveau national, régional et des districts, en analysant les tendances sur plusieurs années pour identifier les patterns de changement et les variations géographiques significatives ;

• Analyse comparative des tendances régionales : Comparer les tendances dans les régions/districts aux tendances nationales selon les différentes sources de données, afin d'identifier les disparités territoriales et les facteurs explicatifs des variations observées ;

• Analyse différentielle de la mortalité : Comparer les tendances des différents indicateurs de mortalité (mortalité néonatale, infantile, maternelle, des enfants de moins de 5 ans et toutes causes confondues), en examinant les corrélations et les divergences entre ces indicateurs pour une compréhension globale de la santé publique ;

• Évolution de la morbidité par contexte épidémiologique : Analyser l'évolution des indicateurs de morbidité au niveau national, régional et des districts en se concentrant sur les maladies les plus pertinentes dans le contexte Burkinabè (paludisme, infections respiratoires, maladies diarrhéiques, malnutrition), avec une attention particulière aux variations saisonnières et géographiques ;

• Analyse de corrélation mortalité-morbidité : Identifier les indicateurs de morbidité qui présentent des tendances similaires à celles des indicateurs de mortalité, et ceux qui diffèrent, afin de mieux comprendre la relation entre mortalité et morbidité dans les différentes régions et d'orienter les interventions de santé publique de manière plus ciblée.

sections.title: Impact Indicators Overview
sections.content: Analysis of key malaria impact indicators including case incidence, test positivity rates, mortality rates, and hospital admissions across Sierra Leone.

sections.title: Mortality and Test Positivity Analysis
sections.content: Comprehensive review of malaria mortality patterns and diagnostic testing outcomes.

sections.title: Case Reporting Analysis
sections.content: Analysis of inpatient deaths and reported malaria cases (both presumed and confirmed) trends.

sections.title: 📊 National Crude Incidence Trends
sections.content: National overview of malaria crude incidence trends and district-level subplot analysis.

sections.title: 🗺️ Geographic Distribution Analysis
sections.content: Spatial analysis of crude incidence changes across districts and chiefdoms.

sections.title: 🌅 Eastern Province Districts
sections.content: Detailed analysis of crude incidence trends in Kailahun, Kenema, and Kono districts.

sections.title: 🗺️ Eastern Province Chiefdom Maps
sections.content: Chiefdom-level crude incidence mapping for Eastern Province districts.

sections.title: 🧭 Northern Province Districts
sections.content: Analysis of crude incidence patterns in Northern Province including Bombali, Falaba, Koinadugu, and Tonkolili.

sections.title: 🌊 Northwest Districts
sections.content: Crude incidence trends in Kambia, Karene, and Port Loko districts.

sections.title: 🌴 Southern Province Districts
sections.content: Southern Province malaria trends including Bo, Bonthe, Moyamba, and Pujehun.

sections.title: 🏙️ Western Area Districts
sections.content: Urban and rural Western Area crude incidence analysis.

sections.title: 📈 CHIE Analysis by Region
sections.content: CHIE (Chiefdom Health Information Exchange) subplot analysis across key districts.

sections.title: 🔍 Suspected Cases Overview
sections.content: Analysis of suspected malaria cases reporting patterns and trends across all districts.

sections.title: 📈 Suspected Cases Trends
sections.content: Temporal analysis of suspected malaria case reporting by district and region.

sections.title: 🧪 Testing Overview
sections.content: Analysis of malaria testing coverage, methods used (RDT vs microscopy), and testing trends.

sections.title: ⚕️ Testing Capacity Analysis
sections.content: Assessment of diagnostic capacity and testing accessibility across health facilities.

sections.title: ✅ Confirmed Cases Overview
sections.content: Analysis of confirmed malaria cases, confirmation rates, and diagnostic accuracy patterns.

sections.title: 📊 Confirmation Rate Trends
sections.content: Temporal and spatial analysis of malaria case confirmation rates and patterns.

sections.title: 💊 Treatment Overview
sections.content: Analysis of malaria treatment coverage, drug availability, and treatment completion rates.

sections.title: 🎯 Treatment Outcomes
sections.content: Assessment of treatment effectiveness and patient outcomes across different regions.

sections.title: ❓ Presumed Cases Overview
sections.content: Analysis of presumptively treated malaria cases and factors influencing presumptive treatment decisions.

sections.title: 🔄 Presumptive Treatment Patterns
sections.content: Geographic and temporal patterns of presumptive malaria treatment across health facilities.

sections.title: 🛡️ ITN Distribution Analysis
sections.content: Analysis of Insecticide-Treated Net distribution, coverage, and utilization patterns.

sections.title: 🏠 Indoor Residual Spraying
sections.content: Assessment of IRS implementation, coverage, and effectiveness in targeted areas.

sections.title: 🏫 School-Based Distribution Program
sections.content: Evaluation of the School-Based Distribution program implementation and outcomes.

sections.title: 📊 DHIS2 Data Analysis
sections.content: Assessment of data quality, completeness, and utilization from the DHIS2 system.

sections.title: 📋 Reporting Quality Assessment
sections.content: Analysis of data reporting timeliness, completeness, and accuracy across facilities.

sections.title: 🔍 Key Findings
sections.content:
The Malaria Program Review reveals significant progress in several areas while highlighting critical gaps that require immediate attention:

• Decline in Incidence: Overall reduction in malaria incidence across most districts
• Improved Testing: Increased diagnostic testing coverage and quality
• Enhanced Surveillance: Strengthened data collection and reporting systems
• Prevention Success: School-Based Distribution showing promising results

sections.title: ⚠️ Key Challenges Identified
sections.content:
• Geographic Disparities: Persistent high transmission areas in certain districts
• Resource Constraints: Limited funding affecting intervention scale-up
• Health System Gaps: Inadequate staffing and infrastructure in remote areas
• Data Quality Issues: Inconsistent reporting from some facilities
• Community Engagement: Variable levels of community participation

sections.title: 📝 Strategic Recommendations
sections.content:
• Scale-up SBD: Expand School-Based Distribution to all districts
• Strengthen Surveillance: Improve data quality and real-time monitoring
• Target High-Risk Areas: Focus resources on persistent transmission hotspots
• Enhance Partnerships: Strengthen coordination between health and education sectors
• Community Mobilization: Increase community ownership and participation
• Capacity Building: Train additional health workers and improve supervision

sections.title: 🚀 Next Steps (2025-2030)
sections.content:
• Strategic Plan Development: Develop new 5-year malaria strategic plan
• Resource Mobilization: Secure funding from Global Fund and other partners
• Implementation Framework: Establish clear timelines and accountability mechanisms
• Monitoring System: Implement robust M&E framework with regular reviews
• Innovation Integration: Pilot new technologies and approaches

sections.title: 🙏 Special Thanks
sections.content: We extend our sincere gratitude to all partners, stakeholders, and communities who made this Malaria Program Review and School-Based Distribution initiative a tremendous success.

sections.title: 🤝 Key Partners and Collaborators
sections.content:
• Ministry of Health and Sanitation (MoHS) - Strategic leadership and policy guidance
• National Malaria Control Programme (NMCP) - Technical expertise and program coordination
• President's Malaria Initiative (PMI) - Financial support and technical assistance
• Abt Associates - Implementation support and capacity building
• School Administrators and Teachers - Frontline implementation and student engagement
• School Quality Assurance (SQA) Officers - Quality monitoring and supervision
• PHU Staff - Community-level health service delivery
• Community Leaders - Mobilization and advocacy support
• Students and Families - Active participation and program champions

sections.title: 🏢 Institutional Support
sections.content:
• WHO Sierra Leone - Technical guidance and standards
• UNICEF - Child health and education sector coordination
• Global Fund - Financial resources and program oversight
• Ministry of Basic and Senior Secondary Education (MBSSE) - Educational platform access
• District Health Management Teams - Local coordination and supervision
• Chiefdom Health Committees - Community-level governance and support
